comments.body: Good idea Green Bird I have found it pretty difficult to find them.

idea: booster. this is a new rail that is 2x faster that the powered rail. it is crafted like a powered rail but instead of redstone it has a diamond. 

pls press "yes" at the top so more people see this
Maybe rather than a whole new update perhaps faster Minecarts and more places to put down rails.
You should also add brakes and chain lifts
what about being able to change the hight of the incline and how steep drops can be? also being able to make loops? what about being able to connect minecarts together?
YES! Cracked stone bricks (and upcoming cracked nether+blackstone brick) would be made this way instead of smelting them.
Emerald ore is actually rarer than ancient debris, but because you need 4 ancient debris to craft a netherite ingot, Netherite is rarer. It's a good idea though.

Unless it provides some sort of bonus, it's just going to be another armor tier players skip over.

And if it provides a bonus like gold does for piglins, then the only piece worth crafting would be boots, just to get the bonus.
PlutonicPoet34  thanks! I'll add something...

Maybe not immune to illager attacks, 394401328391, maybe 80% or 90% immune, or it would be too overpowered. (Player with emerald armor goes into a woodland mansion: "Oi dudes, gimme all your stuff, or I'll kill all of you." Vindicator and Evoker laughs in his/her face. "Ha Ha Ha, that's so funny!" Player runs at vindicator, and hits him with his sword. Vindicator uses his axe. Player takes no damage whatsoever, and kills vindicator. Evoker summons 3 vexes, they swoop down on the player, dealing what should have been 19.5 hearts of damage. Player swipes at the vexes, unharmed. Evoker runs away crying.)
Great idea. I was thinking about this earlier. :)
Maybe you could combine tools and enchanted books on them for less experience?
I like it. Maybe it could use less levels too similar to gold tools being faster.
Yes. It is so annoying having to smelt stone in a normal furnace to make stone bricks. But I know the reason this isn't in the game is to keep a purpose to the normal furnace even in end game.

As the other guy said. It would remove the use of the regular furnace. I would want all of the different furnaces to be useful in their own way. The regular furnace would become redundant without it being the exclusive furnace to melt normal blocks.
Like it can be anything it's next to or only one color
Maybe crafted with glass and some new drop from the Illusioner. It would be a great way to include them into the game
Good idea
It would make spying a lot easier.
Or it Can Be use to make a hidden base whith a nice window view
And stairs, too!

It makes sense! 

It is called a Glowstone

It should have the ability to be shaped like other stones.

This needs more attention, as this feature would be extremely useful. However, it is sort of overpowered. Maybe have the bees be "tamed" by harvesting honey and honeycomb a few times before you can safely place the soul campfire? Like if you don't, the bees will realize what's going on, and snap out of it, then attack the player.
Collecting at night would look so awesome
Great!

The thing about this is that it would make more sense with Java Edition's "Advancments," as those are by world. Bedrock Edition's "Achievements" are by account, so would you get this banner in every single world you have?

You should get a banner pattern, which would also be obtainable through creative.

More banner patterns are nessicary.

That sounds like a brilliant idea, especially for large builds that are hard to see from the ground or navigating back to a base. I think it should be craftable with prismarine crystals and netherite, just to make sure they are fairly difficult to aquire.

I want to recreate that with MCreator but I don't know how to remake the minimap. But if there is a way to create your own items without distributing any vanilla item without mods, I will recreate the "1.RV-Pre1" update!
I think that it can be rarely spawnd on zombie and you will need to kill the zombie and there whold be like 83 present you whold get it.
Maybe it could be found in the end on end islands
I like that the crimson forest has the weeping vines and the warped forest has the nether sprouts. It doesn’t need to be added in my opinion.
I think that a 'small' variant of these should be added. I also think that a 'tall grass' variant should also be added.

+TrailerOctopus

Now that we have twisted vines, the nether sprouts look REALLY out of place.
It really bothers me that they didn’t add two types of the nether sprouts in the first place. Overall, it really doesn’t matter, but it would make since and make my happy.
Yes! 100%!! I don't know how they even missed this opportunity to begin with. Please add, thank you!
you can already find clay, which looks similar to a ball and we also have terracotta
What I mean is to be able to craft clay balls via clay block in the crafting grid which you currently can't

Yes, it's so dumb that we can't do this. Breaking a block already gives 4 clay, the crafting would not break anything, would only save time from the annoying type of grinding ( Dig clay blocks with silk touch to save space, and then placing the blocks and dig again but without the silk touch to get the lumps, it's stupidly annoying for no reason ).

I don’t understand why we can’t do this. Just because we can smelt the blocks into terracotta is no reason to prevent this. I can craft anvils with iron blocks, but we still have the choice to uncraft iron blocks. When I’m mining clay, I make blocks using my inventory crafting grid out of the clay balls so my inventory doesn’t fill up too quickly. That’s the whole purpose, just like our coal. All our ores we can craft into blocks and then reverse craft once home. And clay is as common as coal so there’s no rarity like netherwart. We can’t reverse craft netherwart blocks, and so we have to be careful when we choose to make blocks. But clay? Come on. We do so much with the balls and we need the same convenience of carry that we need with our ores. Besides, allowing us to uncraft the clay blocks prevents farming XP by placing the clay over and over.

Anemones are in the game but the name is given to the Orange-Gray Stripey. Because of this, I think real anemones should be added. However, I would love to see it as a stationary mob (it doesn't move) instead of a block.
I would have Clownfish be able to enter it like silverfish
This sounds cool af
I like this idea. But i think it would be cool if you could upgrade the chest-plate with an elytra and it becomes part of the armor, so the elytra can only break if the armor breaks
Good idea not so sure on functionality
Yeah the bats are kind of useless right now.
I like it :D

Cute idea. I don't think they should wear out though. I also don't really like the idea of a sweeping attack for dogs. I think this could be really fun on horses too. I think if a dog, cat, horse, etc, has these pet wings on, then it should have a small chance of passing onto their young.
You should also be able to change their color.

Do efficiency shears work on wool better?
Maybe the efficiency is not supposed to have an effect, as I don't think it's naturally obtainable, though I could be wrong.
However, regardless of whether or not the efficiency is supposed to be functional, I think vines, wool and leaves should all be broken equally as fast, preferably instant.
I get it when you want vines and you just take 10 years to get many of them, but actually I don’t think it is helpful and vines also break fast right??

I had the same idea while farming vines. It seems inconsistent with the rest of the tools.

I support the suggestion
I tried reporting this as a bug however apparently it was a "feature request" It makes no sense that the tool that is suppose to collect vines is unaffected by the efficiency enchantment.

I don't think it should be on shears I think the idea of keeping shears being able to obtain vines with shears is good and I think efficiency should work on shears but much like the hoe with the wart blocks I think either the hoe or the axe should obtain vines faster because axes do chop away vines very quickly but they're unobtainable with an axe even with silk touch which is unfortunate because on bedrock they allow axes with silk touch to obtain vines of course following the same guidelines as you break a vine higher up all the vines below it won't drop because you only used silk touch on that one vine but either way it just needs to be faster I don't really care what tool it is as long as I can break vines faster I'd be happy.
I'd love to see Aloe Vera added! Maybe even craftable into a healing item?
I'd love to see Aloe Vera added! Maybe even craftable into a healing item?

I too would like to see succulents in minecraft! I think it would work somewhat similar to how tropical fishes are spawned, because there are limited possibilities/color combinations. Succulents also bloom with beautiful flowers! this could be the bees' alternative when they can't find any other flowers available in the desert. Their appearances could also be seasonal, sometimes in full bloom, or just flowerless. I forgot to mention, that they also come in different sizes, like an agave type could normally be just 3x3 blocks wide, and 1 block tall, but when in full bloom, the whole thing would be like 8 blocks tall! the other succulent varieties would just occupy a whole block, and the smaller types, even smaller than usual (like the flower blocks). They could also be in clumps/clusters in 1 block, just like the turtle eggs.

I know this is too long, but everything just looks good the way I imagine it!
Also being able to be in pots
This would be great for #1.20. different types of succulent would give the desert some more life, which would be great.

Mojang: What effects would you like on a beacon?

Me: Yes
It would really helpful in the new caves, hope this get added
1. Please add this mojang we need this
That'd be cool think it should be a cooler trident or smthin though since in reality its not that hard to get you just have to play the game for a bit.
It’s already too easy to get
and netherite

I really agree with you especially with the addition of the copper stairs. There are so many buildings in the world that have golden roof decoration. For example, temples in India which are gilded ... or the roof of the Federal Palace of Switzerland in Bern.
Colored Concrete wall could make this work and would be immersive to the existing items
Orrr..... Coloured Concrete/Terracotta fence, please!
There could be a way to dye wood blocks, so you could have colored slabs, stairs, and doors, as well as fences, and keep some of the different types of wood (oak, birch, etc.) texture and/or color
I love the idea above if I could expand on it. Also if these grates could be placed under a gate (like on a farm) so the damn animals won’t escape every time you open the gate to get out.
Good idea
I think this is a grate idea (heh heh)
